content.webTitle: Mortgage guide: We don't like poor service

fields.headline: We don't like ...
fields.bodyText: Following the Bank of England base rate cut and better fixed-rate deals, the number of mortgage applications is rising. Unfortunately some of the smaller lenders (although this problem is not exclusive to smaller lenders - some of the major lenders are also guilty of complacency) have struggled to maintain service standards. This may be particularly important if you are looking to purchase a property and are under time constraints regarding valuation instruction, exchange dates etc. Certain lenders may not offer the best rates but they will be competitive and offer good service levels. A colleague recently spent more than 30 minutes in a telephone queuing system to a building society chasing an update, which is unacceptable.
